fko.tetris.game

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • fko.tetris.game.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    This represent the internal playfield which basically consists of a background matrices of 10 columns and 40 rows and a current Tetrimino. The matrix coordinates start at 0,0 at the lower left cell and 9,39 with the upper right cell. The background matrix contains all settled Tetriminos. From Tetris Guideline Playfield is 10:22, where rows above 20 are hidden or obstructed by the field frame to trick the player into thinking it's 10:20. In 2002 Guideline, it could be at least 22 height.

    • Method Detail

      • spawn

        public boolean spawn(Tetrimino next)
        Spawns a new Tetrimino.
        Tetriminos are all generated North Facing (just as they appear in the Next Queue) on the 21st and 22nd rows, just above the Skyline. Every Tetrimino that is three Minos wide is generated on the 4th cell across (4, 21) and stretches to the 6th (6, 21). This includes the T-Tetrimino, L-Tetrimino, J-Tetrimino, S-Tetrimino and Z-Tetrimino. The I-Tetrimino and O-Tetrimino are exactly centered horizontally at generation. The I-Tetrimino is generated on the 21st row (not 22nd), stretching from the 4th to 7th cells (4, 21) - (7, 21), and the O-Tetrimino is generated on the 5th and 6th cell (5, 21) - (6, 21).
        Parameters:
        next -
        Returns:
        true if collision detected - false otherwise
